identificationModule.officialTitle: Cognitive Rehabilitation for Participants With Stroke or Brain Injury Using C8 Sciences

collaborators.name: National IT Industry Promotion Agency, Republic of Korea

descriptionModule.briefSummary: C8 sciences program is a cognitive training program mainly developed for the students, and the effectiveness is well established. The aim of this trial is to assess clinical efficacy of the program for cognitive rehabilitation of the patients with stroke or brain injury.

interventions.name: Computerized cognitive training program
interventions.description: 1000 minutes of computerized cognitive rehabilitation with C8 sciences program

interventions.name: Conventional cognitive rehabilitation
interventions.description: Same amount of conventional cognitive rehabilitation

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline Cambridge Neuropsychological Test Automated Battery(CANTAB) Spatial working memory at 34 th intervention
Change from baseline CANTAB Rapid Visual information Processing at 34 th intervention

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Participants with stroke or brain injury
* Cognitive deficits

Exclusion Criteria:

* Uncontrolled medical comorbidities
* Not able to perform outcome measurements
* Aphasia, which hamper communication
* Pre-diagnosed psychological or other neurological disease not relevant to stroke or brain injury

references.citation: Gibson E, Koh CL, Eames S, Bennett S, Scott AM, Hoffmann TC. Occupational therapy for cognitive impairment in stroke patients. Cochrane Database Syst Rev. 2022 Mar 29;3(3):CD006430. doi: 10.1002/14651858.CD006430.pub3.
